analyse-corpus-antconc.title: Analyse de corpus avec AntConc
analyse-corpus-antconc.abstract: L'analyse de corpus est un type d'analyse textuelle qui permet de faire des comparaisons d'objets textuels à grande échelle (la fameuse "lecture à distance" (_distant reading_)).

calibration-radiocarbone-avec-r.title: Calibrer des âges radiocarbone avec R
calibration-radiocarbone-avec-r.abstract: Cette leçon vous apprend à calibrer des âges radiocarbone avec R. Après un rappel sur le principe du radiocarbone et les enjeux de la calibration, cette leçon explique pas à pas comment réaliser la calibration d'un ensemble de dates et comment explorer et présenter les résultats.
calibration-radiocarbone-avec-r.avatar_alt: Vases, meubles et sujets divers peints dans les tombeaux des rois

comprendre-les-expressions-regulieres.title: Comprendre les expressions régulières
comprendre-les-expressions-regulieres.abstract: Dans cette leçon, nous allons voir une utilisation avancée de la fonction rechercher-remplacer d'un logiciel de traitement de texte dans le but d'exploiter la structure d'un court document historique, qui n'est en essence rien d'autre qu'un tableau en prose.
comprendre-les-expressions-regulieres.avatar_alt: Homme lisant un livre à son bureau

comprendre-les-pages-web.title: Comprendre les pages web et le HTML
comprendre-les-pages-web.abstract: Cette leçon propose une introduction au langage HTML et à la structuration des pages web.
comprendre-les-pages-web.avatar_alt: Une femme entend un homme parler à travers un cornet acoustique

debuter-avec-markdown.title: Débuter avec Markdown
debuter-avec-markdown.abstract: Cette leçon est une introduction à Markdown, une syntaxe en texte brut pour le formatage de documents. Vous allez découvrir pourquoi l'utiliser, comment formater des fichiers Markdown et comment prévisualiser de tels fichiers sur le web.
debuter-avec-markdown.avatar_alt: Manuel typographique aux caractères décorés de fleurs

detecter-la-reutilisation-de-texte-avec-.title: Détecter la réutilisation de texte avec Passim
detecter-la-reutilisation-de-texte-avec-.avatar_alt: Pile de journaux entourée de plumes et de fils télégraphiques
detecter-la-reutilisation-de-texte-avec-.abstract: Dans cette leçon, vous serez initié à la détection automatique de la réutilisation des textes avec la bibliothèque Passim. Vous apprendrez comment installer et exécuter Passim et ses dépendances, comment préparer vos textes en tant que fichiers d'entrée adaptés à l'utilisation de Passim et, enfin, comment traiter la sortie générée par Passim pour effectuer des analyses de base.

generer-jeu-donnees-texte-ocr.title: Générer un jeu de données structuré à partir d’un texte océrisé
generer-jeu-donnees-texte-ocr.abstract: Ce tutoriel présente des stratégies pour traiter la sortie OCR brute issue d’un texte scanné, l’analyser afin d'isoler et de corriger les éléments essentiels des métadonnées, et générer un ensemble de données structuré (un dictionnaire Python) à partir de celle-ci.
generer-jeu-donnees-texte-ocr.avatar_alt: Une petite boîte avec une rangée de livres

installation-modules-python-pip.title: Installation de bibliothèques Python avec pip
installation-modules-python-pip.abstract: Il existe de nombreuses manières d'installer des bibliothèques Python externes; cette leçon explique l'une des méthodes les plus courantes utilisant pip.

installation-windows-py.title: Installer un environnement de développement intégré pour Python (Windows)
installation-windows-py.abstract: Cette leçon vous montrera comment installer un environnement de développement pour Python sur un ordinateur exécutant le système d'exploitation Windows.

installer-ide-python-linux.title: Installer un environnement de développement intégré pour Python (Linux)
installer-ide-python-linux.abstract: Cette leçon vous montrera comment installer un environnement de développement pour Python sur un ordinateur exécutant le système d'exploitation Linux.

intro-aux-bots-twitter.title: Une introduction aux Bots Twitter avec Tracery
intro-aux-bots-twitter.abstract: Cette leçon explique comment créer de simples bots Twitter à l'aide de la grammaire Tracery et du service Cheap Bots Done Quick. Tracery est interopérable avec plusieurs langages de programmation et peut être intégrée dans des sites web, des jeux ou des bots.

introduction-a-heurist.title: Introduction à Heurist
introduction-a-heurist.abstract: Ce tutoriel présente l'utilisation d'Heurist, un logiciel de gestion de base de données dédié aux sciences humaines et sociales. En s'appuyant sur un jeu de données de sites de fouilles archéologiques, il illustre le fonctionnement d'Heurist et ses fonctionnalités.
introduction-a-heurist.avatar_alt: Planisphères Célestes, Boreal et Austral, projetés sur le plan de l'Équateu

introduction-a-la-stylometrie-avec-pytho.title: Introduction à la stylométrie en Python
introduction-a-la-stylometrie-avec-pytho.abstract: Ce tutoriel vous apprendra comment appliquer diverses méthodes stylométriques pour déterminer les auteurs de textes disputés. Trois méthodes sont abordées: les courbes caractéristiques de composition de Mendenhall, la méthode du khi carré de Kilgariff et, enfin, la méthode du Delta de John Burrows.
introduction-a-la-stylometrie-avec-pytho.avatar_alt: Femme lisant à côté d'une peinture

introduction-aux-carnets-jupyter-noteboo.title: Introduction aux carnets Jupyter
introduction-aux-carnets-jupyter-noteboo.abstract: Les carnets Jupyter proposent un environnement dans lequel il est possible de combiner librement le code informatique et le texte en langage naturel. Cette leçon explique comment installer le logiciel Jupyter Notebook, comment créer et exécuter des carnets Jupyter, et dans quels contextes ces carnets peuvent se révéler particulièrement utiles.

introduction-et-installation.title: Introduction à Python et installation
introduction-et-installation.abstract: Cette première leçon de notre section traitant des sources en ligne a pour but de vous préparer, vous et votre ordinateur, à commencer à programmer. Nous allons nous concentrer sur l'installation de l'environnement de développement requis, qui est gratuit et fiable. Puis nous vous aiderons à compléter un premier essai avec un programme simple qui donnera des résultats immédiats.

manipuler-chaines-caracteres-python.title: Manipuler des chaînes de caractères en Python
manipuler-chaines-caracteres-python.abstract: Cette leçon constitue une brève introduction aux techniques de manipulation des chaînes de caractères en Python.

nettoyer-ses-donnees-avec-openrefine.title: Nettoyer ses données avec OpenRefine
nettoyer-ses-donnees-avec-openrefine.abstract: Ce tutoriel se concentre sur la façon dont les chercheurs et chercheuses peuvent évaluer et agir sur l'exactitude des données.
nettoyer-ses-donnees-avec-openrefine.avatar_alt: Deux hommes faisant la lessive à l'extérieur

preserver-ses-donnees-de-recherche.title: Préserver ses données de recherche
preserver-ses-donnees-de-recherche.abstract: Cette leçon donne des pistes aux historiens et aux historiennes pour documenter, structurer et pérenniser leurs données de recherche.

redaction-durable-avec-pandoc-et-markdow.title: Rédaction durable avec Pandoc et Markdown
redaction-durable-avec-pandoc-et-markdow.abstract: Cette leçon vous apprendra les notions de base de Markdown, une syntaxe de balisage facile à lire et écrire, ainsi que Pandoc, un outil en ligne de commande qui permet de convertir du texte brut en différents types de fichiers bien formatés: PDF, .docx, HTML, LaTeX, diaporama, et plus encore.
redaction-durable-avec-pandoc-et-markdow.avatar_alt: Homme assis devant une table à dessin

telecharger-des-pages-web-avec-python.title: Télécharger des pages web avec Python
telecharger-des-pages-web-avec-python.abstract: Cette leçon présente les URL et explique comment utiliser Python pour télécharger et sauvegarder le contenu d'une page Web sur votre poste de travail.
telecharger-des-pages-web-avec-python.avatar_alt: Un homme de grande taille et une femme de petite taille

travailler-avec-des-fichiers-texte.title: Travailler avec des fichiers texte en Python
travailler-avec-des-fichiers-texte.abstract: Cette leçon vous explique comment manipuler des fichiers texte en Python.
travailler-avec-des-fichiers-texte.avatar_alt: Homme à lunettes lisant un livre d'alphabet

analyzing-documents-with-tfidf.title: Analyzing Documents with TF-IDF
analyzing-documents-with-tfidf.abstract: This lesson focuses on a foundational natural language processing and information retrieval method called Term Frequency - Inverse Document Frequency (tf-idf). This lesson explores the foundations of tf-idf, and will also introduce you to some of the questions and concepts of computationally oriented text analysis.

applied-archival-downloading-with-wget.title: Applied Archival Downloading with Wget
applied-archival-downloading-with-wget.abstract: Now that you have learned how Wget can be used to mirror or download specific files from websites via the command line, it's time to expand your web-scraping skills through a few more lessons that focus on other uses for Wget's recursive retrieval function.

automated-downloading-with-wget.title: Automated Downloading with Wget
automated-downloading-with-wget.abstract: Wget is a useful program, run through your computer's command line, for retrieving online material.
automated-downloading-with-wget.avatar_alt: Diagram of an elevator system in a mineshaft

basic-text-processing-in-r.title: Basic Text Processing in R
basic-text-processing-in-r.abstract: Learn how to use R to analyze high-level patterns in texts, apply stylometric methods over time and across authors, and use summary methods to describe items in a corpus.

beginners-guide-to-twitter-data.title: Beginner's Guide to Twitter Data
beginners-guide-to-twitter-data.abstract: Learn how to acquire Twitter data and process them to make them usable for further analysis.
beginners-guide-to-twitter-data.avatar_alt: Le Petit poisson et le pêcheur (The Fisherman and the Little Fish) / G. Doré ; A. Bertrand, Bibliothèque nationale de France, ark:/12148/btv1b10321920p

building-static-sites-with-jekyll-github.title: Building a static website with Jekyll and GitHub Pages
building-static-sites-with-jekyll-github.abstract: This lesson will help you create entirely free, easy-to-maintain, preservation-friendly, secure website over which you have full control, such as a scholarly blog, project website, or online portfolio.
building-static-sites-with-jekyll-github.avatar_alt: An illustration of Dr. Jekyll transforming into Mr. Hyde

cleaning-data-with-openrefine.title: Cleaning Data with OpenRefine
cleaning-data-with-openrefine.abstract: This tutorial focuses on how scholars can diagnose and act upon the accuracy of data.

cleaning-ocrd-text-with-regular-expressi.title: Cleaning OCR’d text with Regular Expressions
cleaning-ocrd-text-with-regular-expressi.abstract: Optical Character Recognition (OCR)—the conversion of scanned images to machine-encoded text—has proven a godsend for historical research. This lesson will help you clean up OCR'd text to make it more usable.
cleaning-ocrd-text-with-regular-expressi.avatar_alt: A typesetter and inker at work on a printing press

clustering-with-scikit-learn-in-python.title: Clustering with Scikit-Learn in Python
clustering-with-scikit-learn-in-python.abstract: This tutorial demonstrates how to apply clustering algorithms with Python to a dataset with two concrete use cases. The first example uses clustering to identify meaningful groups of Greco-Roman authors based on their publications and their reception. The second use case applies clustering algorithms to textual data in order to discover thematic groups. After finishing this tutorial, you will be able to use clustering in Python with Scikit-learn applied to your own data, adding an invaluable method to your toolbox for exploratory data analysis.

code-reuse-and-modularity.title: Code Reuse and Modularity in Python
code-reuse-and-modularity.abstract: Computer programs can become long, unwieldy and confusing without special mechanisms for managing complexity. This lesson will show you how to reuse parts of your code by writing functions and break your programs into modules, in order to keep everything concise and easier to debug.

collaborative-blog-with-jekyll-github.title: Running a Collaborative Research Website and Blog with Jekyll and GitHub
collaborative-blog-with-jekyll-github.abstract: In this lesson you will be introduced to the challenges and opportunities that Jekyll, a popular, static site generator, offers for publishing collaborative, ongoing research online.
collaborative-blog-with-jekyll-github.avatar_alt: A man and a woman dancing in a group

common-similarity-measures.title: Understanding and Using Common Similarity Measures for Text Analysis
common-similarity-measures.abstract: This lesson introduces three common measures for determining how similar texts are to one another: city block distance, Euclidean distance, and cosine distance. You will learn the general principles behind similarity, the different advantages of these measures, and how to calculate each of them using the SciPy Python library.

corpus-analysis-with-antconc.title: Corpus Analysis with Antconc
corpus-analysis-with-antconc.abstract: Corpus analysis is a form of text analysis which allows you to make comparisons between textual objects at a large scale (so-called 'distant reading').

correspondence-analysis-in-r.title: Correspondence Analysis for Historical Research with R
correspondence-analysis-in-r.abstract: This tutorial explains how to carry out and interpret a correspondence analysis, which can be used to identify relationships within categorical data.
correspondence-analysis-in-r.avatar_alt: Diagram of a cube with labeled edges

counting-frequencies.title: Counting Word Frequencies with Python
counting-frequencies.abstract: Counting the frequency of specific words in a list can provide illustrative data. This lesson will teach you Python's easy way to count such frequencies.
counting-frequencies.avatar_alt: Disgruntled man sitting on a log surrounded by birds

creating-an-omeka-exhibit.title: Creating an Omeka Exhibit
creating-an-omeka-exhibit.abstract: Now that you've added items to your Omeka site and grouped them into collections, you're ready for the next step: taking your users on a guided tour through the items you've collected.
creating-an-omeka-exhibit.avatar_alt: Ornate room filled with paintings hung salon-style

creating-and-viewing-html-files-with-pyt.title: Creating and Viewing HTML Files with Python
creating-and-viewing-html-files-with-pyt.abstract: Here you will learn how to create HTML files with Python scripts, and how to use Python to automatically open an HTML file in Firefox.

creating-apis-with-python-and-flask.title: Creating Web APIs with Python and Flask
creating-apis-with-python-and-flask.abstract: Learn how to set up a basic Application Programming Interface (API) to make your data more accessible to users. This lesson also discusses principles of API design and the benefits of APIs for digital projects.
creating-apis-with-python-and-flask.avatar_alt: Diagram with a series of arcs describing a quarter circle

creating-mobile-augmented-reality-experi.title: Creating Mobile Augmented Reality Experiences in Unity
creating-mobile-augmented-reality-experi.abstract: This lesson serves as an introduction to creating mobile augmented reality applications. Augmented reality (AR) can be defined as the overlaying of digital content (images, video, text, sound, etc.) onto physical objects or locations, and it is typically experienced by looking through the camera lens of an electronic device such as a smartphone, tablet, or optical head-mounted display.
creating-mobile-augmented-reality-experi.avatar_alt: An optical instrument resembling a telescope

creating-network-diagrams-from-historica.title: From Hermeneutics to Data to Networks: Data Extraction and Network Visualization of Historical Sources
creating-network-diagrams-from-historica.abstract: Network visualizations can help humanities scholars reveal hidden and complex patterns and structures in textual sources. This tutorial explains how to extract network data (people, institutions, places, etc) from historical sources through the use of non-technical methods developed in Qualitative Data Analysis (QDA) and Social Network Analysis (SNA), and how to visualize this data with the platform-independent and particularly easy-to-use Palladio.
creating-network-diagrams-from-historica.avatar_alt: Diagram of the earth and moon's revolution around the sun

crowdsourced-data-normalization-with-pan.title: Crowdsourced-Data Normalization with Python and Pandas
crowdsourced-data-normalization-with-pan.abstract: Pandas is a popular and powerful package used in Python communities for data handling and analysis. This lesson describes crowdsourcing as a form of data creation as well as how pandas can be used to prepare a crowdsourced dataset for analysis. This lesson covers managing duplicate and missing data and explains the difficulties of dealing with dates.
crowdsourced-data-normalization-with-pan.avatar_alt: A crowd of people chipping away at a stone

data-mining-the-internet-archive.title: Data Mining the Internet Archive Collection
data-mining-the-internet-archive.abstract: The collections of the Internet Archive include many digitized historical sources. Many contain rich bibliographic data in a format called MARC. In this lesson, you'll learn how to use Python to automate the downloading of large numbers of MARC files from the Internet Archive and the parsing of MARC records for specific information such as authors, places of publication, and dates. The lesson can be applied more generally to other Internet Archive files and to MARC records found elsewhere.
data-mining-the-internet-archive.avatar_alt: Group of of men working in a mine

data-wrangling-and-management-in-r.title: Data Wrangling and Management in R
data-wrangling-and-management-in-r.abstract: This tutorial explores how scholars can organize 'tidy' data, understand R packages to manipulate data, and conduct basic data analysis.

dealing-with-big-data-and-network-analys.title: Dealing with Big Data and Network Analysis Using Neo4j
dealing-with-big-data-and-network-analys.abstract: In this lesson we will learn how to use a graph database to store and analyze complex networked information. This tutorial will focus on the Neo4j graph database, and the Cypher query language that comes with it.

detecting-text-reuse-with-passim.title: Detecting Text Reuse with Passim
detecting-text-reuse-with-passim.abstract: In this lesson you will learn about text reuse detection -- the automatic identification of reused passages in texts -- and why you might want to use it in your research. Through a detailed installation guide and two case studies, this lesson will teach you the ropes of Passim, an open source and scalable tool for text reuse detection.
detecting-text-reuse-with-passim.avatar_alt: Stack of newspapers surrounded by quills and telegraph wires

downloading-multiple-records-using-query.title: Downloading Multiple Records Using Query Strings
downloading-multiple-records-using-query.abstract: Downloading a single record from a website is easy, but downloading many records at a time – an increasingly frequent need for a historian – is much more efficient using a programming language such as Python. In this lesson, we will write a program that will download a series of records from the Old Bailey Online using custom search criteria, and save them to a directory on our computer.
downloading-multiple-records-using-query.avatar_alt: Figures working in a mine, pushing carts

editing-audio-with-audacity.title: Editing Audio with Audacity
editing-audio-with-audacity.abstract: In this lesson you will learn how to use Audacity to load, record, edit, mix, and export audio files.

exploring-and-analyzing-network-data-wit.title: Exploring and Analyzing Network Data with Python
exploring-and-analyzing-network-data-wit.abstract: This lesson introduces network metrics and how to draw conclusions from them when working with humanities data. You will learn how to use the NetworkX Python package to produce and work with these network statistics.

extracting-illustrated-pages.title: Extracting Illustrated Pages from Digital Libraries with Python
extracting-illustrated-pages.abstract: Machine learning and API extensions by HathiTrust and Internet Archive are making it easier to extract page regions of visual interest from digitized volumes. This lesson shows how to efficiently extract those regions and, in doing so, prompt new, visual research questions.

extracting-keywords.title: Using Gazetteers to Extract Sets of Keywords from Free-Flowing Texts
extracting-keywords.abstract: This lesson will teach you how to use Python to extract a set of keywords very quickly and systematically from a set of texts.

fetch-and-parse-data-with-openrefine.title: Fetching and Parsing Data from the Web with OpenRefine
fetch-and-parse-data-with-openrefine.abstract: OpenRefine is a powerful tool for exploring, cleaning, and transforming data. In this lesson you will learn how to use Refine to fetch URLs and parse web content.

finding-places-world-historical-gazettee.title: Finding Places in Text with the World Historical Gazeteer
finding-places-world-historical-gazettee.abstract: Researchers often need to be able to search a corpus of texts for a defined list of terms and historians are often interested in certain places named in a text or texts. This lesson details how to programmatically search documents for a list of terms, including place names and then how to obtain coordinates and map historical place names with the World Historical Gazetteer.
finding-places-world-historical-gazettee.avatar_alt: An image of a globe with a Mercator projection

from-html-to-list-of-words-1.title: From HTML to List of Words (part 1)
from-html-to-list-of-words-1.abstract: In this two-part lesson, we will build on what you’ve learned about Downloading Web Pages with Python, learning how to remove the HTML markup from the webpage of Benjamin Bowsey’s 1780 criminal trial transcript. We will achieve this by using a variety of string operators, string methods, and close reading skills. We introduce looping and branching so that programs can repeat tasks and test for certain conditions, making it possible to separate the content from the HTML tags. Finally, we convert content from a long string to a list of words that can later be sorted, indexed, and counted.
from-html-to-list-of-words-1.avatar_alt: A giraffe being mimicked by a human

from-html-to-list-of-words-2.title: From HTML to List of Words (part 2)
from-html-to-list-of-words-2.abstract: In this lesson, you will learn the Python commands needed to implement the second part of the algorithm begun in the lesson 'From HTML to a List of Words (part 1)'.
from-html-to-list-of-words-2.avatar_alt: A soldier being mocked by a man

generating-an-ordered-data-set-from-an-o.title: Generating an Ordered Data Set from an OCR Text File
generating-an-ordered-data-set-from-an-o.abstract: This tutorial illustrates strategies for taking raw OCR output from a scanned text, parsing it to isolate and correct essential elements of metadata, and generating an ordered data set (a python dictionary) from it.
generating-an-ordered-data-set-from-an-o.avatar_alt: A small case with a set of books

geocoding-qgis.title: Geocoding Historical Data using QGIS
geocoding-qgis.abstract: Learn how to use QGIS to convert lists of place names in to geographic coordinates, allowing you to map them.
geocoding-qgis.avatar_alt: A young man kissing a young woman on the cheek

geoparsing-text-with-edinburgh.title: Geoparsing English-Language Text with the Edinburgh Geoparser
geoparsing-text-with-edinburgh.abstract: This tutorial teaches users how to use the Edinburgh Geoparser to process a piece of English-language text, extract and resolve the locations contained within it, and plot them as a web map.
geoparsing-text-with-edinburgh.avatar_alt: Map of the city of Edinburgh

georeferencing-qgis.title: Georeferencing in QGIS 2.0
georeferencing-qgis.abstract: In this lesson, you will learn how to georeference historical maps so that they may be added to a GIS as a raster layer.

using-geospatial-data-to-inform-historic.title: Using Geospatial Data to Inform Historical Research in R
using-geospatial-data-to-inform-historic.abstract: In this lesson, you will use R-language to analyze and map geospatial data.
using-geospatial-data-to-inform-historic.avatar_alt: An aerial view of city blocks

getting-started-with-markdown.title: Getting Started with Markdown
getting-started-with-markdown.abstract: In this lesson, you will be introduced to Markdown, a plain text-based syntax for formatting documents. You will find out why it is used, how to format Markdown files, and how to preview Markdown-formatted documents on the web.
getting-started-with-markdown.avatar_alt: Ornate decorated characters from a typographical manual

getting-started-with-mysql-using-r.title: Introduction to MySQL with R
getting-started-with-mysql-using-r.abstract: This lesson will help you store large amounts of historical data in a structured manner, search and filter that data, and visualize some of the data as a graph.

googlemaps-googleearth.title: Intro to Google Maps and Google Earth
googlemaps-googleearth.abstract: Google My Maps and Google Earth provide an easy way to start creating digital maps. With a Google Account you can create and edit personal maps by clicking on My Places.
googlemaps-googleearth.avatar_alt: An old man consulting a large globe with a compass

gravity-model.title: Introduction to Gravity Models of Migration & Trade
gravity-model.abstract: This lesson introduces gravity models as a means for determining the probable distribution of entities across space in historical datasets. It does so through a case study of historical migration patterns.
gravity-model.avatar_alt: Farmer standing before a fruit tree

installing-omeka.title: Installing Omeka
installing-omeka.abstract: This lesson will teach you how to install your own copy of Omeka.
installing-omeka.avatar_alt: A figure working at a machine with gear diagrams

installing-python-modules-pip.title: Installing Python Modules with pip
installing-python-modules-pip.abstract: There are many ways to install external python libraries; this tutorial explains one of the most common methods using pip.

interactive-text-games-using-twine.title: Interactive Fiction in the Humanities Classroom: How to Create Interactive Text Games Using Twine
interactive-text-games-using-twine.abstract: This lesson provides strategies for incorporating game creation into the classroom. The first half of the lesson discusses the challenges and benefits of teaching game creation while the second half includes a technical tutorial for Twine, an open source game creation tool.
interactive-text-games-using-twine.avatar_alt: An image of a knot with many ropes

intro-to-bash.title: Introduction to the Bash Command Line
intro-to-bash.abstract: This lesson will teach you how to enter commands using a command-line interface, rather than through a graphical interface. Command-line interfaces have advantages for computer users who need more precision in their work, such as digital historians. They allow for more detail when running some programs, as you can add modifiers to specify exactly how you want your program to run. Furthermore, they can be easily automated through scripts, which are essentially recipes of text-based commands.
intro-to-bash.avatar_alt: Soldiers in antique armor with spears

intro-to-linked-data.title: Introduction to the Principles of Linked Open Data
intro-to-linked-data.abstract: Introduces core concepts of Linked Open Data, including URIs, ontologies, RDF formats, and a gentle intro to the graph query language SPARQL.
intro-to-linked-data.avatar_alt: An old man with a woman on each arm

intro-to-powershell.title: Introduction to the Windows Command Line with PowerShell
intro-to-powershell.abstract: This tutorial will introduce you to the basics of Windows PowerShell, the standard command-line interface for Windows computers.

intro-to-twitterbots.title: An Introduction to Twitterbots with Tracery
intro-to-twitterbots.abstract:
An Introduction to Twitter Bots with Tracery
This lesson explains how to create simple twitterbots using Tracery and the Cheap Bots Done Quick service. Tracery exists in multiple languages and can be integrated into websites, games, bots.
intro-to-twitterbots.avatar_alt: A device with several interlocking gears

introduction-and-installation.title: Python Introduction and Installation
introduction-and-installation.abstract: This first lesson in our section on dealing with Online Sources is designed to get you and your computer set up to start programming. We will focus on installing the relevant software – all free and reputable – and finally we will help you to get your toes wet with some simple programming that provides immediate results.

introduction-to-ffmpeg.title: Introduction to Audiovisual Transcoding, Editing, and Color Analysis with FFmpeg
introduction-to-ffmpeg.abstract: This lesson introduces the basic functions of FFmpeg, a free command-line tool used for manipulating and analyzing audiovisual materials.

website-api.title: Introduction to Populating a Website with API Data
website-api.abstract: This lesson introduces a way to populate a website with data obtained from another website via an Application Programming Interface (API). Using some simple programming, it provides strategies for customizing the presentation of that data, providing flexible and generalizable skills.
website-api.avatar_alt: A mechanical device with gears and wheels

introduction-to-stylometry-with-python.title: Introduction to stylometry with Python
introduction-to-stylometry-with-python.abstract: In this lesson you will learn to conduct 'stylometric analysis' on texts and determine authorship of disputed texts. The lesson covers three methods: Mendenhall's Characteristic Curves of Composition, Kilgariff's Chi-Squared Method, and John Burrows' Delta Method.
introduction-to-stylometry-with-python.avatar_alt: A woman reading next to a painting

json-and-jq.title: Reshaping JSON with jq
json-and-jq.abstract: Working with data from an art museum API and from the Twitter API, this lesson teaches how to use the command-line utility _jq_ to filter and parse complex JSON files into flat CSV files.
json-and-jq.avatar_alt: A grid-like device for drawing lines

jupyter-notebooks.title: Introduction to Jupyter Notebooks
jupyter-notebooks.abstract: Jupyter notebooks provide an environment where you can freely combine human-readable narrative with computer-readable code. This lesson describes how to install the Jupyter Notebook software, how to run and create Jupyter notebook files, and contexts where Jupyter notebooks can be particularly helpful.

keywords-in-context-using-n-grams.title: Keywords in Context (Using n-grams) with Python
keywords-in-context-using-n-grams.abstract: This lesson takes the frequency pairs collected in "Counting Frequencies" and outputs them in HTML.
keywords-in-context-using-n-grams.avatar_alt: A figure dropping two bottles of alcohol

linux-installation.title: Setting up an Integrated Development Environment for Python (Linux)
linux-installation.abstract: This lesson will help you set up an integrated development environment for Python on a computer running the Linux operating system.

mac-installation.title: Setting Up an Integrated Development Environment for Python (Mac)
mac-installation.abstract: This lesson will help you set up an integrated development environment for Python on a computer running a Mac operating system.

manipulating-strings-in-python.title: Manipulating Strings in Python
manipulating-strings-in-python.abstract: This lesson is a brief introduction to string manipulation techniques in Python.

mapping-with-python-leaflet.title: Web Mapping with Python and Leaflet
mapping-with-python-leaflet.abstract: This tutorial teaches users how to create a web map based on tabular data.

naive-bayesian.title: Supervised Classification: The Naive Bayesian Returns to the Old Bailey

naive-bayesian.avatar_alt: A man peers through a geometric tool

normalizing-data.title: Normalizing Textual Data with Python
normalizing-data.abstract: In this lesson, we will make the list we created in the 'From HTML to a List of Words' lesson easier to analyze by normalizing this data.
normalizing-data.avatar_alt: Tall woman dragging a short young man

ocr-and-machine-translation.title: OCR and Machine Translation
ocr-and-machine-translation.abstract: This lesson covers how to convert images of text into text files and translate those text files. The lesson will also cover how to organize and edit images to make the conversion and translation of whole folders of text files easier and more accurate. The lesson concludes with a discussion of the shortcomings of automated translation and how to overcome them.

output-data-as-html-file.title: Output Data as an HTML File with Python
output-data-as-html-file.abstract: This lesson takes the frequency pairs created in the 'Counting Frequencies' lesson and outputs them to an HTML file.
output-data-as-html-file.avatar_alt: A woman wearing an elaborate dress accompanied by two putti

output-keywords-in-context-in-html-file.title: Output Keywords in Context in an HTML File with Python
output-keywords-in-context-in-html-file.abstract: This lesson builds on 'Keywords in Context (Using N-grams)', where n-grams were extracted from a text. output-keywords-in-context-in-html-file.avatar_alt: A monkey dancing with a lion and a bear

preserving-your-research-data.title: Preserving Your Research Data
preserving-your-research-data.abstract: This lesson will suggest ways in which historians can document and structure their research data so as to ensure it remains useful in the future.

qgis-layers.title: Installing QGIS 2.0 and Adding Layers
qgis-layers.abstract: In this lesson you will install QGIS software, download geospatial files like shapefiles and GeoTIFFs, and create a map out of a number of vector and raster layers.

r-basics-with-tabular-data.title: R Basics with Tabular Data
r-basics-with-tabular-data.abstract: This lesson teaches a way to quickly analyze large volumes of tabular data, making research faster and more effective.

research-data-with-unix.title: Counting and mining research data with Unix
research-data-with-unix.abstract: This lesson will look at how research data, when organised in a clear and predictable manner, can be counted and mined using the Unix shell.
research-data-with-unix.avatar_alt: A diagram of a miner sorting ore into an apparatus

sentiment-analysis.title: Sentiment Analysis for Exploratory Data Analysis
sentiment-analysis.abstract: In this lesson you will learn to conduct 'sentiment analysis' on texts and to interpret the results. You will learn to install all appropriate software and to build a reusable program that can be applied to your own texts.
sentiment-analysis.avatar_alt: A laughing man and a grouchy man

sonification.title: The Sound of Data (a gentle introduction to sonification for historians)

text-mining-with-extracted-features.title: Text Mining in Python through the HTRC Feature Reader

transforming-xml-with-xsl.avatar_alt: A peacock with a woman's head

transliterating.title: Transliterating non-ASCII characters with Python
transliterating.abstract: This lesson shows how to use Python to transliterate automatically a list of words from a language with a non-Latin alphabet to a standardized format using the American Standard Code for Information Interchange (ASCII) characters.

understanding-regular-expressions.title: Understanding Regular Expressions
understanding-regular-expressions.abstract: In this lesson, we will use advanced find-and-replace capabilities in a word processing application in order to make use of structure in a brief historical document that is essentially a table in the form of prose.

up-and-running-with-omeka.title: Up and Running with Omeka.net
up-and-running-with-omeka.abstract: Omeka.net makes it easy to create websites that show off collections of items.

using-javascript-to-create-maps.title: Using JavaScript to Create Maps of Correspondence
using-javascript-to-create-maps.abstract: Demonstrates how to use the JavaScript library "Leaflet" to produce an interactive map that can be hosted online or viewed locally, and demonstrates how to customize many of its features.

vector-layers-qgis.title: Creating New Vector Layers in QGIS 2.0
vector-layers-qgis.abstract: In this lesson you will learn how to create vector layers based on scanned historical maps.

viewing-html-files.title: Understanding Web Pages and HTML
viewing-html-files.abstract: This lesson introduces you to HTML and the web pages it structures.
viewing-html-files.avatar_alt: A woman listening to a man through an ear trumpet

visualizing-data-with-bokeh-and-pandas.title: Visualizing Data with Bokeh and Pandas
visualizing-data-with-bokeh-and-pandas.abstract: In this lesson you will learn how to visually explore and present data in Python by using the Bokeh and Pandas libraries.
visualizing-data-with-bokeh-and-pandas.avatar_alt: Men with torches in an antique tomb

windows-installation.title: Setting Up an Integrated Development Environment for Python (Windows)
windows-installation.abstract: This lesson will help you set up an integrated development environment for Python on a computer running the Windows operating system.

working-with-batches-of-pdf-files.abstract: Learn how to perform OCR and text extraction with free command line tools like Tesseract and Poppler and how to get an overview of large numbers of PDF documents using topic modeling.

working-with-web-pages.title: Downloading Web Pages with Python

analise-sentimento-exploracao-dados.title: Análise de sentimento para exploração de dados

camadas-vetoriais-qgis.abstract: Nesta lição, aprenderá como criar camadas vetoriais com base em mapas históricos digitalizados.

instalacao-windows.abstract: Esta lição irá auxiliar na configuração de um ambiente de desenvolvimento integrado para o Python num computador com o Sistema Operacional Windows.

introducao-omeka-net.title: Introdução ao Omeka.net
introducao-omeka-net.abstract: Com o Omeka.net é fácil criar sites na web para mostrar coleções de itens.

manipular-strings-python.title: Manipular strings com Python
manipular-strings-python.abstract: Esta lição é uma breve introdução às técnicas de manipulação de strings com Python

contar-frecuencias-de-palabras-con-pytho.title: Contar frecuencias de palabras con Python
contar-frecuencias-de-palabras-con-pytho.abstract: Contar la frecuencia de palabras específicas en una lista puede proveer datos ilustrativos. Con esta lección aprenderás una forma fácil para contar dichas frecuencias usando Python.

contabilizar-y-minar-datos-de-investigac.abstract: En esta lección aprenderás cómo los datos de tu investigación pueden ser contados y extraídos mediante el shell Unix, cuando están organizados de manera clara y predecible.
contabilizar-y-minar-datos-de-investigac.avatar_alt: Grabado en blanco y negro de un minero trabajando sobre una plataforma adentro de una mina.

datos-tabulares-en-r.avatar_alt: Grabado de la letra r al estilo de letra iluminada.

de-html-a-lista-de-palabras-(parte-1).title: De HTML a lista de palabras (parte 1)
de-html-a-lista-de-palabras-(parte-1).abstract: En esta lección en dos partes partiremos de lo que has aprendido sobre Descargar páginas web con Python, para aprender cómo remover las etiquetas HTML de la página web de la transcripción del juicio criminal contra Benjamin Bowsey de 1780. Lograremos esto utilizando una variedad de operadores de cadenas, métodos de cadenas y habilidades de lectura cercana. Vamos a presentar bucles (looping) y condicionales (branching), de manera que los programas puedan repetir tareas y pruebas para ciertas condiciones, haciendo posible separar el contenido de las etiquetas HTML. Por último, convertimos el contenido de una cadena larga a una lista de palabras que posteriormente podrán ser ordenadas, indexadas y contadas.
de-html-a-lista-de-palabras-(parte-1).avatar_alt: Grabado de una jirafa de perfil mirando a un hombre también de perfil parado sujetando muletas para simular la postura de la jirafa.

introducci\u00f3n-a-la-l\u00ednea-de-com.title: Introducción a la línea de comandos en Bash
introducci\u00f3n-a-la-l\u00ednea-de-com.avatar_alt: un grupo de soldados (infantería) a punto de atacar
introducci\u00f3n-a-la-l\u00ednea-de-com.abstract: Con esta lección aprenderás introducir órdenes a través de una Interfaz de Línea de comandos, en lugar de hacerlo en una Interfaz Gráfica de Usuario. La Interfaz de Línea de comandos es útil cuando el usuario necesita un mayor grado de precisión para llevar a cabo su investigación. Por ejemplo, permite añadir modificadores de tal modo que se puede ejecutar un programa de una manera determinada. Asimismo, te será útil para automatizar programas mediante scripts, es decir, recetas o paquetes que contienen una serie de instrucciones.

introducci\u00f3n-a-la-transcodificaci\u.title: Introducción a la transcodificación, edición y visualización de datos audiovisuales con FFmpeg

introducci\u00f3n-a-markdown.title: Introducción a Markdown
introducci\u00f3n-a-markdown.abstract: En esta lección se ofrece una introducción a Markdown, un lenguaje de marcado con sintaxis en texto plano para generar textos con formato. Descubrirás el porqué se utiliza, cómo dar formato a los archivos de Markdown y cómo obtener una vista previa en la web de los documentos formados con Markdown.

/esdata-mining-the-internet-archive.title: Minería de datos en las colecciones del Internet Archive
/esdata-mining-the-internet-archive.abstract: Las colecciones del Internet Archive incluyen una gran cantidad de fuentes históricas digitalizadas. Muchas de ellas contienen datos bibliográficos importantes en un formato llamado MARC. En esta lección aprenderás a usar Python para automatizar la descarga de archivos MARC en grandes cantidades desde el Internet Archive, así como el análisis sintáctico de archivos MARC con información específica tal como autores, lugar de publicación y fechas. La lección puede aplicarse de una manera general para otros elementos del Internet Archive así como en archivos MARC en cualquier otro repositorio.
